step_by_step_thinking: The patient's symptoms and lab findings align with cholesterol embolization syndrome (CES). Key factors include post-procedural timing (2 weeks after cardiac catheterization), renal biopsy showing spindle-shaped vacuoles (characteristic of cholesterol emboli), eosinophilia, and clinical features like livedo reticularis. CES is linked to invasive procedures and presents with renal dysfunction, eosinophilia, and systemic inflammation. Other options (renal papillary necrosis, vasculitides) lack the specific biopsy findings and procedural context.
